title: Lakireddy Bali Reddy College of Engineering: Admission 2024, Cutoff, Courses, Fees, Reviews, Placement

Lakireddy Bali Reddy College of Engineering Admission is based on national level entrance exam and merit basis. Check latest updates and news on Lakireddy Bali Reddy College of Engineering Admission 2024, Cutoff, Courses, Fees, Reviews, Rankings, Placement and other details.

basic_info.name: LBRCE Krishna Admission
description: Admission is offered entirely on the basis of merit in the entrance exams taken up. This college offers degree courses of B.Tech. at the UG level and M.Tech., MBA, and MCA at PG level.

Admission to B.Tech. program is based on state level common entrance examination conducted by government of Andhra Pradesh i.e. AP EAMCET. B.Tech. admissions are done under two categories i.e. category A and category B. Category A admissions are conducted for 70% seats through state level ranking of AP EAMCET or AP ECET. Category B admissions are conducted for 30% seats under management and NRI quota.
Other courses are solely based on the scores of the entrance exams. Application processes are all online.

basic_info.name: LBRCE Krishna Placements
description: Training cum placement cell was established with a great vision and main motto to provide 100% placements to all the students. Few of the faculty members from each department are also appointed as placement co-ordinator and meritorious students are also nominated as student coordinators to assess the training and placement status. The training and placement cell helps the student develop industry interaction and it also helps in scheduling campus training programs from second year onwards to prepare students to Cater according to the corporate needs and requirements.

faqs.question: Ques. Is taking admission for B.Tech. in LBRCE Krishna worth it?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, B.Tech. program is quite popular and also it holds 64th position all over India among the private colleges as per Data-Quest.

faqs.question: Ques. How does LBRCE Krishna perform in terms of placement?
faqs.answer: Ans.Placement is quite good in this college. There is a dedicated training and placement cell in the college which is determined to provide 100% placement to all the students and also more than 33 companies visit this college each year for the recruitment drive.

faqs.question: Ques. How are the accommodation facilities provided by LBRCE Krishna?
faqs.answer: Ans.There is a separate accommodation facility for boys and girls. It can accommodate 300 students each. It also provides sports facilities for the hostellers.

faqs.question: Ques. Is there a cut off score for the EAMCET at LBRCE Krishna?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, there is a cut off score that a student needs to qualify in order to take admission in the respective course.

faqs.question: Ques. Does LBRCE Krishna provide a research facility for UG and PG students?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, there is a separate facility for students who want to do research i.e. JRF to attract the youth.

Section.name: About LBRCE
Section.description:
Lakireddy Bali Reddy College of Engineering (LBRCE) was established by Sri Lakireddy Bali Reddy in 1998. It is an autonomous college approved by AICTE and affiliated to Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University (JNTUK), Kakinada. This college is located in L.B Reddy Nagar, Krishna district, Mylavaram, Andhra Pradesh. It offers 8 UG courses and 6 PG courses. This institute offers admission to students in B.Tech. programmes on the basis of state level entrance examination EAMCET and M.Tech. programmes on the basis of GATE/PGECET score. It also offers admission to MBA and MCA programmes on the basis of ICET score.
The rankings banged by the institution are tabulated below.

Admission is offered entirely on the basis of merit in the entrance exams taken up. This college offers degree courses of B.Tech. at the UG level and M.Tech., MBA, and MCA at PG level.
Admission to B.Tech. program is based on state level common entrance examination conducted by government of Andhra Pradesh i.e. AP EAMCET. B.Tech. admissions are done under two categories i.e. category A and category B. Category A admissions are conducted for 70% seats through state level ranking of AP EAMCET or AP ECET. Category B admissions are conducted for 30% seats under management and NRI quota.
Other courses are solely based on the scores of the entrance exams. Application processes are all online.

Few of the faculty members from each department are also appointed as placement co-ordinator and meritorious students are also nominated as student coordinators to assess the training and placement status. The training and placement cell helps the student develop industry interaction and it also helps in scheduling campus training programs from second year onwards to prepare students to Cater according to the corporate needs and requirements.

LBRCE Krishna Courses.Eligibility: Candidates must have passed 10+2 with major in science or mathematics stream from a recognised board
LBRCE Krishna Courses.Specializations: Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Artificial intelligence Engineering, and Electrical Instrumentation Engineering.

LBRCE Krishna Courses.Eligibility: Candidates must have completed B.E/B.Tech. in relevant stream of engineering from a recognised university and with 50% marks
LBRCE Krishna Courses.Specializations: Computer Science and Engineering, Power Electronics and Drives, Thermal Engineering, and VLSI Design and Embedded Systems.

LBRCE Krishna Courses.Eligibility: Candidates must have passed bachelor's degree of 3 years duration in any discipline with 50% marks from any recognised university. Candidates who are appearing for final year degree examination are also eligible

Candidates must have passed bachelor's degree of 3 years duration in any discipline scoring at least 50% of marks with mathematics compulsorily from any recognised university. Candidates who are appearing for final year degree examination are also eligible
